result: Reduce the ship's speed by 1. Stacks.
Reduce the ship's total energy output by 10%. Stacks.
All weapon systems of the ship suffer -1 pool. Stacks
A random crew member suffers 2d6 damage.
The ship suffers -1 pool on all piloting checks.
All repair attempts on the ship suffer -1 pool.
No further effects other than the injury pool modifier.
Lose the ship's base energy production.
The shield generator stops working until repaired.
All Sensor operations suffer -3 pool. Stacks
An amount of crew members equal to the bridge size of the ship lose 2d6 health each.
The board AI shuts down.
A random weapon system becomes unoperable until repaired.
Reduce the primary and secondary soak by 1. Stacks.
Deactivate the strongest remaining energy generator.
One random module of your ship is unusable until repaired. The GM rolls on all remaining modules and uses their capacity as a weight to determine which module gets hit.
All crew take 1d6 damage (ignoring armor and soak).
25% of the cargo's items are ejected into space, suffering immense damage.
The ship immediately loses 50% of its remaining fuel.
Communication systems and electronical warfare become unavailable.
Loss of atmosphere within 1d6 rounds.

The ship cannot perform maneuver, dock or evade actions any longer. Since the engine shuts down, artificial gravity is also lost - crew members may have to perform Zero-G checks for specific actions aboard the ship.
A random crew has to perform an injury roll with 8 dice.
All bridge crew needs to perform a Survival d4 check. If they fail, they become unconscious. Otherwise they suffer a random severity 2 injury.
A random weapon system is permanently destroyed - it requires replacement.
A random crew member gets ejected into space.
All systems become unusable, and the ship is drifting dead in space.
The ship breaks into several pieces, which each section having little to no energy.
The ship explodes in a large fireball.
